name: asciidoc-preview
description: Show an HTML preview for the AsciiDoc content in the current editor

scrollMode.title: Synchronize the preview pane
scrollMode.description:
If set, synchronize the preview pane with the AsciiDoc source pane.
WARNING: The scroll position on the preview pane does not automatically scroll the AsciiDoc source pane.

showTitle.description:
If set, displays an embedded documentâ€™s title.
Mutually exclusive with the notitle attribute.

sectionNumbering.description:
Auto-number section titles.
- Enabled by default (equivalent to `-a sectnums=@`)
- Always enabled (equivalent to `-a sectnums`)
- Always disabled (equivalent to `-a sectnums!`)
- Not specified
http://asciidoctor.org/docs/user-manual/#numbering

tocType.title: Always show Table of Contents
tocType.description:
Override `:toc:` attribute defined in documents.
Choose `none` to define manually the `:toc:` attribute in documents.

frontMatter.title: Allow Front Matter
frontMatter.description: If set, consume YAML-style front matter at the top of the document and store it in the front-matter attribute.

forceExperimental.title: Always enable AsciiDoctor experimental extensions
forceExperimental.description:
The features behind this attribute are subject to change and may even be removed in a future version of AsciiDoctor.
Currently enables the UI macros (`button`, `menu` and `kbd`).

safeMode.description:
Set safe mode 'level': `unsafe`, `safe`, `server` or `secure`.
Disables potentially dangerous macros in source files, such as `include::[]`.
Set safe mode level to `safe` to enable include macros, but restricts access to ancestor paths of source file.
http://asciidoctor.org/docs/user-manual/#running-asciidoctor-securely

baseDir.title: Base directory
baseDir.description:
The default value `{docdir}` make the base directory match the document directory.
Use the value `-` to use absolute path.
More informations: http://asciidoctor.org/docs/user-manual/#ruby-api-options

defaultAttributes.default: platform=opal platform-opal env=browser env-browser source-highlighter=highlight.js data-uri!

openInEditor.title: Open the generated HTML source code in Atom.

openInBrowser.title: Open the generated HTML file in your default browser.

enabled.title: Use asciidoctor-pdf
enabled.description: [asciidoctor-pdf](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-pdf) must be installed in your system.

openWithExternal.title: Automatically open the PDF after generation with the default PDF viewer.
